title: Organic Chemistry: Hydrocarbons and Functional Groups

vocab.definition: Study of carbon-containing compounds and their properties
Compound containing only carbon and hydrogen atoms
Specific arrangement of atoms that determines chemical properties
Saturated hydrocarbon with single bonds only
Compounds with same molecular formula but different structures

teachingNotes: Use molecular models to show 3D structures. Emphasize the role of carbon's bonding capacity in organic diversity.

sample.question: What is the study of carbon-containing compounds called?

truefalse.question: Hydrocarbons contain only carbon and hydrogen atoms.

multiplechoice.question: What determines the chemical properties of organic molecules?

fillintheblank.question: Compounds with the same molecular formula but different structures are called ________.

shortanswer.question: Why is carbon important in organic chemistry?
